message.content: hello claude! i'd like to add `tree -L 2 -a --dirsfirst` and similar commands to @Argcfile.sh

content.text: I'll add tree commands to your Argcfile.sh. Let me create a tree command section with useful variations.

input.new_string:
# @cmd Display directory tree structure
# @option -L --level <INT> Depth of tree (default: 2)
# @flag -a --all Show hidden files
# @flag -d --dirs-only Show only directories
# @flag -f --full-path Show full path prefix
# @flag -I --ignore-git Ignore .git directories
# @arg path Path to display (default: current directory)
tree() {
  local depth="${argc_level:-2}"
  local path="${argc_path:-.}"
  local args="-L $depth --dirsfirst"

  [ -n "$argc_all" ] && args="$args -a"
  [ -n "$argc_dirs_only" ] && args="$args -d"
  [ -n "$argc_full_path" ] && args="$args -f"
  [ -n "$argc_ignore_git" ] && args="$args -I '.git'"

  command tree $args "$path"
}

# @cmd Quick tree view (2 levels, hidden files, dirs first)
tree::quick() {
  tree -L 2 -a --dirsfirst
}

# @cmd Project overview (ignore common directories)
tree::project() {
  tree -L 3 -a --dirsfirst -I 'node_modules|.git|__pycache__|*.pyc|dist|build'
}

# @cmd Source code tree (show only code files)
tree::src() {
  tree -L 4 --dirsfirst -P '*.sh|*.js|*.ts|*.py|*.go|*.rs|*.c|*.cpp|*.h|*.md|*.json|*.yaml|*.yml' --prune
}

eval "$(argc --argc-eval "$0" "$@")"

toolUseResult.newString:
# @cmd Display directory tree structure
# @option -L --level <INT> Depth of tree (default: 2)
# @flag -a --all Show hidden files
# @flag -d --dirs-only Show only directories
# @flag -f --full-path Show full path prefix
# @flag -I --ignore-git Ignore .git directories
# @arg path Path to display (default: current directory)
tree() {
  local depth="${argc_level:-2}"
  local path="${argc_path:-.}"
  local args="-L $depth --dirsfirst"

  [ -n "$argc_all" ] && args="$args -a"
  [ -n "$argc_dirs_only" ] && args="$args -d"
  [ -n "$argc_full_path" ] && args="$args -f"
  [ -n "$argc_ignore_git" ] && args="$args -I '.git'"

  command tree $args "$path"
}

# @cmd Quick tree view (2 levels, hidden files, dirs first)
tree::quick() {
  tree -L 2 -a --dirsfirst
}

# @cmd Project overview (ignore common directories)
tree::project() {
  tree -L 3 -a --dirsfirst -I 'node_modules|.git|__pycache__|*.pyc|dist|build'
}

# @cmd Source code tree (show only code files)
tree::src() {
  tree -L 4 --dirsfirst -P '*.sh|*.js|*.ts|*.py|*.go|*.rs|*.c|*.cpp|*.h|*.md|*.json|*.yaml|*.yml' --prune
}

eval "$(argc --argc-eval "$0" "$@")"
toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Claude Git Helper Scripts

set -e

# @describe Git helper commands for Claude Code

# @cmd Git commands
git-flow() { :; }

# @cmd Stage a file for commit
# @arg file! <PATH> The file path to stage
git-flow::add() {
  if [ -f "$argc_file" ]; then
    git add "$argc_file"
  else
    echo "Error: Specify an actual file, not a directory or pattern"
  fi
}

# @cmd Create a git commit with staged changes
# @arg message! The commit message
git-flow::commit() {
  git commit -m "$argc_message"
}

# @cmd Git-Flow Release
git-flow::release() {
  :
}

# @cmd Create a new release using git-flow and GitHub
# @arg version! The version number (e.g., 0.0.1)
# @option --title <STRING> Release title (defaults to "Release v{version}")
# @option --notes <STRING> Release notes (optional)
git-flow::release::finish() {
  git flow release finish -m "Release version $argc_version" "$argc_version"
  git push origin master --tags
  if [ -n "$argc_notes" ]; then
    gh release create "$argc_version" --title "${argc_title:-Release v$argc_version}" --notes "$argc_notes"
  else
    gh release create "$argc_version" --title "${argc_title:-Release v$argc_version}" --generate-notes
  fi
}

eval "$(argc --argc-eval "$0" "$@")"

+# @cmd Source code tree (show only code files)

content.text:
Done! I've added tree commands to your Argcfile.sh with:

- **`argc tree`** - Flexible tree command with options for depth, hidden files, etc.
- **`argc tree::quick`** - Your requested `tree -L 2 -a --dirsfirst` 
- **`argc tree::project`** - Project overview ignoring common build/dependency dirs
- **`argc tree::src`** - Source code focused tree showing only code files

You can now use commands like:
- `argc tree::quick` for the exact command you wanted
- `argc tree -L 3 -a` for custom depth with hidden files
- `argc tree -d` for directories only
